intro: Cowellocassia racemosa, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Cowellocassia racemosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
